body.name: ARCTIC P12 (5 Pack) - 120 mm Case Fan, Pressure-optimised, Quiet Motor, Computer, Fan Speed: 1800 RPM - Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery February 23 - 25 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
FREE pickup February 23 - 25 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: OPTIMISED FOR STATIC PRESSURE: The fan guarantees extremely efficient cooling, even with increased air resistance, therefore, the P12 is particularly suitable for use on heatsinks and radiators
HIGH QUALITY BEARING: Thanks to an alloy/lubricant combination developed in Germany, friction within the bearing is reduced and greater efficiency is achieved
INNOVATIVE DESIGN: The innovative design of the fan blades improves the air flow and facilitates a highly efficient ventilation, the impeller was designed with a focus on minimzing the noise level
LONG SERVICE LIFE: The Fluid Dynamic Bearing comes with an oil capsule that avoids lubricant leakage, thus this bearing is as quiet as a sleeve bearing but comes with a higher service life
TECHNICAL DATA: Fan speed: 1800 RPM, Airflow: 56.3 CFM/95.65 m³/h (@ 1800 RPM), Noise Level: 0.3 Sone (@ 1800 RPM), Pin: 3-pin
body.description: General Data Performance Fan Speed: 1800 rpm Airflow: 56.3 CFM/95.7 m³/h Static Pressure: 2.20 mm H₂O Noise Level: 0.3 Sone Operating Ambient Temperature: 0 - 40 °C Fan Fan Frame: Standard Control Type: Fixed Speed Connector: 3-Pin-Connector Fan Bearing: Fluid Dynamic Bearing Electric Characteristics Typical Voltage: 12 V DC Starting Voltage: 2.8 V Current/Voltage: 0.16 A | 12 V Cable Length: 400 mm

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Optimised for Static Pressure During the development of the new P12, special emphasis was placed on a focused airstream and thus a high static pressure. The fan assures extremely efficient cooling, even with increased air resistance. Therefore, the P12 is particularly suitable for use on heatsinks and radiators. Lower Power Consumption A 10 °C lower motor temperature roughly doubles the life span of a fan. The new ARCTIC motor has a four times longer service life through its low coil temperature. High Quality Bearing Thanks to an alloy/lubricant combination developed in Germany, friction within the bearing is reduced and greater efficiency is achieved. As a result, there is less heat development as well as less bearing noise, which means you can enjoy a longer service life from your fan. Highly Efficient The ARCTIC P12 Case Fan is the ultimate PC-Cooler solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I tested it at 5 VDC and 12VDC. It is nice and quiet.There is a link to the Arctic website, about halfway down the page of this item, that says "User Guide (PDF)".When you follow that link, it just shows you a scan code or URL to get to the P12 manual page. At the Arctic site, under "Controlling A Fan / In a DYI Project" there is a chart showing that the max RPM at 12VDC is 1000RPM. I have posted that chart here. Apparently that graph is not the correct one (read test below).Then I stuck it on my Gigabyte Aorus B450 motherboard and found that the speed sensor is not working, although I could throttle the speed up and down manually using the BIOS utility. Probably won't return it because I really do not need the tach sensor.I hooked it up to a ATX power supply and read the RPM with a laser photo tach.Result at 12V: 1840 rpm. So, I believe the 1800rpm rating.I also tested it while used in a solder fume extractor and it worked okay, although I do not have the activated filter installed yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for quiet Corsi-Rosenthal air cleaner boxes.
reviews.reviewText: I use these pressure fans to construct C-R boxes. Each box can have between 6 and 9 fans and they are quiet! The best focused pressure fan for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, cheap, simple, and effective
reviews.reviewText: Simple 3 pin fans that get the job done. I have three plugged into a header running full speed as intake fans(3 fans on the right). Theyre definitely quiet enough for me, they make some noise but really in my opinion it's not noticable at all. Incredible value for money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Let the air flow
reviews.reviewText: Keeps things cool and a deal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fine but has a problem...
reviews.reviewText: Needed to replace one of the fans on the bottom of my case, this worked fine and was cheap. Problem is the 3 pin power connector length is not very generous. It wouldn't even reach to my fan controller card behind the motherboard.It barely reached an extra 3 pin system fan controller head I had on the motherboard. If you are building in a full sized ATX case and cord length is a concern, I would seriously consider other fans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are great fans, they are very quiet and I've used them for a long time now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Cost, meets needs and great performance
reviews.reviewText: Cost to quality is as good as i could find. Would recommend. I used these Fans to replace my old ones that either broke, stopped working at times or had low preformace, there were also my stock fans.very happy with these. I will be ordering some.of these Fans in the next size up also now
Me costaron solo 200 pesos no hacen nada de ruido y su caudal de aire es bastante bueno , los recomiendo al cien.

reviews.reviewTitle: Make sure you have enough fan headers!
reviews.reviewText: My motherboard only came with 1 CPU fan header and 2 fan headers, this is quite dumb in my opinion of the motherboard. I think going forward, all future motherboards should have minimum of 4 + CPU fan headers.. Anyways, anyone buying this consider buying a SATA or MOLEX to 3/4pin fan adapter. It's cheap and solved my problem. These fans are so easy to install and work as intended. They're honestly quiet, most times I'm playing games or listening to music so either loud speakers or headphones on. I don't hear them. As for helping the temp of my CPU and GPU? I noticed -15 to -20 for CPU and -10 for GPU temp when gaming compared to my old setup. I am using 6 of these fans, 3 on the front for sucking, 2 on the top to blow out and 1 in the back to blow out. The side with sticker is sucking side. There is an arrow imprinted on the fan if you're unsure which way the air blows, look for it.
